results.title: Pat Cash tennis my way
results.brief_description: Pat Cash and his coach Ian Barclay look at aspects of the game of tennis. Features special slow motion and still sequences to help study Pat’s technique. Also covers highlights from Grand Slam, Wimbledon and Davis Cup matches.
results.description: Pat Cash and his coach Ian Barclay look at aspects of the game of tennis. Features special slow motion and still sequences to help study Pat’s technique. Also covers highlights from Grand Slam, Wimbledon and Davis Cup matches.

results.title: Pat and Eddy's greyhound racing family
results.creator_credit: Daniel Scharf, Film Victoria, ABC-TV (Australia), AFFC and Brian McKenzie
results.brief_description: Brian McKenzie documents the Seager family who are a family dedicated to the racing of their beloved greyhounds. The family has grown-up with the ritual of training, caring and racing the dogs, but as the teenagers grow up, their independent lives take them increasingly away from this family pursuit. Tenderly compiled with sometimes humorous but gentle observations of the family, we are led more deeply into the psyche of the Australian spirit.

results.title: Pasteur's experiments
results.creator_credit: Gakken Company, Masaji Hara and Yasuaki Okada
results.brief_description: A puppet film which shows the history of experiments dealing with the spontaneous generation of life. Demonstrates that microbes do not arise spontaneously from meat. Good for showing the experimental method.

results.title: Pasteur
results.brief_description:
A biopic of the famous doctor whose research culminatd with the discovery of a vaccine against rabbies.

Credits: Director, writer, Sacha Guitry ; photography, Jean Bachelet ; music, Louis Beydts.
Cast: Sacha Guitry, Jean Perier, Henry Bonvallet, Gaston Dubosc, Francois Rodon.

results.title: Past, present and promise
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
In this first program Philip Zimbardo introduces us to the fascinating science of psychology, a science at the crossroads of a wide variety of subjects such as philosophy, anthropology, biochemistry and artificial intelligence. He outlines what psychologists do and some of the different approaches taken to the study of the brain, mind and behaviour, including a brief history of psychology.

results.title: Past times
results.creator_credit: Trevor Lunn, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Presented by Rob Gell, this video looks at Australia’s pre-history with reference to creatures living during the Proterozoic and Phanerozoic eons. One of a series produced in conjunction with Youth/ANZAAS.

results.title: Past is prologue: a camera view of a new Norway
results.brief_description: Contrasts the 1100th anniversary of Tonsberg with industry and modern technology. Looks briefly at heavy industry, ship-building, the commissioning of a new oil tanker, and the extent of off-shore drilling. Modern sculpture and space age architecture finish this survey of the new Norway.
